title.narrative: Scaling-up Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency in the Tunisian Building Sector

description.narrative: Energy consumption in the Tunisian building sector represents 22% of consumption total, expected to increase to 35% by 2030. The NAMA Support Project (NSP) promotes the uptake of energy efficiency and renewable energy measures across the building sector by addressing barriers such as insufficient access to capital, technical and institutional capacities and low awareness, aiming to upscale this to sector transformation. Existing programmes’ financial mechanisms will be strengthened, legal/regulatory frameworks enhanced and awareness increased through communication campaigns. The NSP is expected to leverage about EUR 46 m in form of equity and soft loans and almost EUR 24 m of public funds through a government investment subsidy. This will result in 60 MW of additional photovoltaic (PV) capacity in the building sector and 1,076,246 tCO2 emissions avoided over the lifetime of the PV systems.
